auth.checkEmail: Check your email for a sign-in link

dashboard.title: Your Mental Wellness Dashboard
dashboard.subtitle: Track your worries, reflect on your thoughts, and find peace of mind

worries.title: Your Worries
worries.subtitle: Capture and categorize your concerns to process them mindfully
worries.bodyFeeling: Where do you feel this in your body?
worries.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this worry?

reflections.title: Your Reflections
reflections.subtitle: Process your thoughts through guided self-inquiry
reflections.evidenceFor: Why does this feel so true to me?
reflections.evidenceAgainst: What might my wiser self say?
reflections.alternativeView: Could there be another story here?
reflections.worstCaseReality: What am I most afraid of and how real is it?
reflections.gentleAction: What is one gentle thing I can do?
reflections.feelingNow: How am I feeling right now?

hero.title: Ease Your Mind, Find Your Peace

nextStep.title: Your next gentle step
nextStep.description: Offload looping thoughts into a structured flow. Separate facts from fears, surface balanced perspectives and practice calmer narratives that stick.
nextStep.privacy: Private by default • You own your data

howItWorks.title: How Ease Helps
howItWorks.subtitle: A structured, science-informed flow to externalize worry, evaluate it rationally, and cultivate calm.

capture.title: Capture
capture.desc: Lighten mental load by safely storing and labeling worries with context.

challenge.title: Challenge
challenge.desc: Use cognitive techniques to examine evidence, distortions, and probability.

reframe.title: Reframe & Grow
reframe.desc: Generate balanced thoughts, track insights, and reinforce adaptive patterns.

addWorry.title: Add a Worry
addWorry.subtitle: Externalize the thought so you can evaluate it later with clarity.

signInTip.title: Quick tip
signInTip.message: Sign in to sync worries across devices. Unsigned worries stay only in this browser.

form.nameHelp: Keep it simple and specific - this helps you recognize the worry later
form.descriptionLabel: Why does it matter to you?
form.descriptionHelp: Express what's really at stake for you - there's no wrong way to share
form.categoryHelp: Categorizing helps you spot patterns over time
form.bodyLabel: Where do you feel this in your body?
form.bodyHelp: Physical awareness helps you recognize worry patterns early
form.intensityLabel: How intense does this feel right now?
form.intensityHelp: Your current feeling level - this can change, and that's okay

addWorry.encouragement: You're taking a brave step by acknowledging this worry. Remember, you're not alone in this.
addWorry.processLater: You'll be guided to process this worry when you're ready

validation.required: Please fill in both the worry name and description.

errors.saveFailed: Something went wrong saving your worry. It may have been stored locally.

errors.generic: Something went wrong. Please try again.
errors.networkError: Network error. Please check your connection.
errors.unauthorized: You are not authorized to perform this action.
errors.notFound: The requested resource was not found.
errors.validationError: Please check your input and try again.

calmCorner.title: Your Calm Corner
calmCorner.subtitle: Find peace in the present moment with guided breathing and grounding exercises

breathing.title: Guided Breathing Exercise
breathing.subtitle: 4-4-6-2 breathing pattern • Proven to activate your relaxation response
breathing.readySubtitle: Follow the circle and let your breath guide you to calm

techniques.title: Quick Calming Techniques
techniques.subtitle: Simple, effective tools you can use anywhere to find calm in moments of stress

progressiveRelaxation.title: Progressive Relaxation
progressiveRelaxation.description: Tense and release each muscle group, starting from your toes and working up to your head.

grounding.title: 5-4-3-2-1 Grounding
grounding.description: Name 5 things you see, 4 you can touch, 3 you hear, 2 you smell, and 1 you taste.

selfMassage.title: Gentle Self-Massage
selfMassage.description: Massage your temples, shoulders, or hands with slow, circular motions.

mindfulObservation.title: Mindful Observation
mindfulObservation.description: Focus completely on one object near you. Notice its color, texture, and details.

affirmations.title: Gentle Reminders
affirmations.subtitle: Compassionate words to comfort your heart and remind you of your strength

list.feeling: This feeling will pass, just like clouds in the sky.
list.safe: I am safe in this moment, right here, right now.
list.visitors: My worries don't define me; they're just visitors.
list.handle: I can handle whatever comes my way.
list.okay: It's okay to not be okay sometimes.
list.worthy: I am worthy of peace and calm.

emergency.title: Need Immediate Support?
emergency.subtitle: If you're in crisis or having thoughts of self-harm, please reach out immediately
emergency.reminder: Remember: Seeking help is a sign of strength, not weakness. You matter, and there are people who care about you.

worryReflection.title: Worry Jar
worryReflection.worryTimeHelp: Set aside time to process worries

emptyJar.title: Your worry jar is empty
emptyJar.subtitle: No worries captured yet. Add one to get started!

releasedWorries.title: Released Worries
releasedWorries.subtitle: You've let go of {count} worry || You've let go of {count} worries
